intro: Alsine repens, commonly known as匍匐冰草, is a low-growing annual herbaceous plant native to temperate regions. It features a prostrate growth habit with slender, hairy stems that spread along the ground. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters, typically blooming in early summer. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered with fine hairs. Alsine repens is adapted to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas.
